description: She thought she met the love of her life on a dating app — he said he was stationed overseas and messaged her every day for months. When he said he needed help covering a sudden medical emergency, she wired the money… and never heard from him again.
how to spot it: If someone you’ve never met keeps avoiding video calls or in-person visits, it’s a red flag. A real partner won’t ask you to send money to a stranger across the world.

description: One woman got an urgent email that her bank account was locked — it looked exactly like the real thing. She clicked the link, logged in, and the next morning found her account drained.
how to spot it: If you get a scary email or text, don’t click anything — open the app or go straight to the official site instead. Scammers often copy logos and names, but the web address or email is slightly off.

description: He was thrilled to land a remote job without an interview — they even ‘hired’ him the same day. But after sending $150 for a ‘background check,’ the company vanished and stopped replying.
how to spot it: If a job offer comes too easily and asks you to send money, hit pause. Real employers won’t ask you to pay out of pocket just to get started.

description: She found a site selling designer shoes for half the price and placed an order — but weeks later, a cheap plastic keychain showed up instead. The website and customer support disappeared overnight.
how to spot it: If the price looks too good to be true, it probably is. Before buying, search for reviews and see how long the website’s been around.
